  Of course Mr. Butler was gorgeous and did fine on his job.(surprise! He sings pretty good). And Ms. Hillary Swank and Lisa Kudrow added to the enjoyment of in my opinion was a VERY good movie. A keeper.
Had me crying but also remembering that life go's on when a loved on had passed. Would watch it again.

I put off seeing this one because I thought it was going to be depressing but I was on a Gerard Butler kick so I took a chance. What a lovely love story. Upbeat and fun to watch. Couldn't wait for each letter to come. I was really glad I rented it.
I suggest tissues!!!! Such a beautiful love story, only wish more men were actually like that! Definitively recommend this movie to everyone.

A widow follows a trail of letters from her dead husband, who is trying to help her move on with her life from beyond the grave. My wife was bawling over this movie. I didn't cry - cause I'm too manly - and I thought it got kind of sappy. The portrayal of a widow who can't move on from her husband's death felt real, though. I can totally see myself that way if my wife died. The ending was a nice twist on the romcom genre, and the whole thing felt better than average. Worth seeing.
Despite not being a fan of "chick flicks" I tried to keep an open mind.  This movie was just flat boring and dull.  Gerard Butler should be slapped.
From the first 5 minutes of the movie I cried, laughed, cried. I have to say it was one of the best chic flix I have ever watched!!!
Wonderful movie! Inspiring ~ thought provoking ~ loving ~ funny ~ caring ~ touching ~ and more! A must see !

I've seen this movie multiple times now. When I think about it, I don't remember how funny it is and think of it as boring, but when I watch it again, it's fun and funny at times. I highly recommend for anyone who likes a good romantic comedy.

I guess it must just be me, judging from the other reviews, but I found this movie extremely depressing.  I cried through much of it.  In the beginning, I felt bad for Gerard Butler's character who was engaging and adorable but who had to deal with a bitchy, self-centered, unreasonable wife.  Then for the rest of the movie the grief process was so painful to watch.  Anyone that has suffered through a painful loss in the past will identify with the wife's pain.  The efforts of friends and family to help were relatively useless and not that enjoyable to watch either.  I disliked the twist at the end, and the assumption that William was the guy for her because he had a nice body was sort of disgusting.  Here she had just gone through a profound grief experience and she is supposed to be all happy again because she falls into bed with a nice-looking guy.  Please.  Gerard Butler was the real star of the movie, and his role in the film was minimal.  I would not recommend it unless you are eager to experience suffering along with the Hilary Swank character and watch scene after scene of her selfish, obnoxious behavior.
Must have been poorly made as if failed to keep running before movie was over.  We had to buy it from online in order to see the end.

I gave this movie the highest rating you had . I absolutly love this movie its funny its sad its every thing you could want in a good movie I truly wish they would make second movie. No matter how many times I watch it I never get tired of it
In my favorite chick flick collection, yeah it has some sad parts, but they're not excruciating and it just makes you feel good in the end.
Love the movie, romance, laughter and tears.  Great overall story.  Wish she (Hillary Swanks character) was a little nicer, she's so bitchy at times.

The premise is unique and interesting, but it lost its charm after the hour and a half mark for me. It has some funny moments, but it is depressing at a lot of levels. The ending also was not-so-inspiring and a little too honest for the genre of... whatever genre this movie was supposed to be.

I usually do not go for this type movie - the big tear jerker chick flick - but I loved this movie and still pull it up to watch when nothing else satisfies me.  No deep thinking needed. Sit back and enjoy. It's even visually pleasant - character and scenery. LOL
My daughter wanted this for a gift. She said she loved it. I have seen it before and I love the movie, too.
I love this movie for the romance and great story.  Loved seeing Ireland in the movie.  And the people there.
The gift of love even after death....recieved 2 discs...one widescreen and the other full-screen...nice to have the two options...one disc skipped....
Love this movie, its a great love story and gives you great ideas if this were to happen to me
It was an amazing feel good movie..Loved it. It had comedy, sadness and just makes ya feel good. Great movie.
Great movie, great price. Definitely worth buying, I don't regret it at all. Movie was new as promised and in good condition.
Sweet movie; HIllary is believable and good as her character, and Gerard shows his tender, sweet side, while staying as sexy as ever.
Sad, but a great movie. Original plot. Tear-jerker! I hope to have a loving, thoughtful, and creative husband one day.
I love, love, love this movie.  Gerard Butler AND Jeffrey Dean Morgan in the same movie and in Ireland. What more could I ask for?
Real good movie

This movie has it all in my opinion. very touching story, great romance, beautiful scenery (Ireland), gorgeous men (Gerard Butler, Jeffrey Dean Morgan), uplifting ending, although rather sad in parts, great acting (Hilary Swank is magical in this role!). It starts out slow but keeps getting better and better.

A little light, but delightful anyway. Hilary Swank is a great actress, although she seems a bit awkward as a love interest.
But the concept of the movie was fun, and the trips to Ireland were great.
Liked this dvd. Watched it awhile ago so don't remember the plot. Would probably be liked for most family members.
I love this movie! I really really liked the price, and no scratches everything was perfect! Thank you very much!

P.S. I'm Dead would be another good title. Hillary Swank is such a spoiled girl in her movies that she ruins romance in every one of them. I think her goal in life is to convince girls everywhere that romance is to treat your guy like crap and he will coming running to you because of it. The Dumbook, That other one where channing tatum runs around kissing her feet for two hours; they are all the same movie.
This is one of my favorite love stories. I HAD to have it for my library of DVDs!!!! Definitely  Chick-flik, but I saw some emotion with my husband out of the corner of my eye.
A good movie to watch for both parties.  Funny, sad, entertaining and cute.  Would recommend and watch again and again.

This is one of my favorite boo-hoo movies, ever.  I've watched it several times and I know it will make me cry but then there will be this very happy ending.  I know exactly what will happen and it still makes me cry (just like Gone with the Wind).  This movie made me a fan of Gerard Butler.  Now I have several of his movies.  I don't think this movie will ever get old for me and it definitely won't wind up at the Goodwill (where all my unwanted movies go).
Great movie -watched it on a girl's weekend away and we all loved it.  Would watch it again - glad we rented it
This is a total chick flick!  Not saying anything bad about it, just being honest!  Both my daughters loved it, but then again they're girls!
I have a secret crush on Gerard Butler and have seen this movie probably 30X.  It is always great!  The DVD version is really well done as well.

A bit on the different side... such a wonderful story... touching.. gives you the fuzzies and makes you cry...makes you laugh and in the end you walk away with a smile and feeling good!!  Awesome movie!!

Excellent Movie... kind of sad, but with a great ending, the kind that you need to see.  I had it on my DVR and liked it, but didn't want to erase, so I bought the DVD in order to open up more time on the DVR.

This show runs the gamut...it made me laugh, then I cried, then I got angry, then started all over again.  My ex-husband recommended it, then sat and watched it with me till the end, even though he'd seen it before.
This is added to my crazy movie selection. thank you, I really love this movie and it's nice to be able to watch it whenever I want.

I watched this one more out of curiosity, not knowing much what it was about.  And I was shocked at how much I liked it.

The cast was outstanding, even the ones I normally don't care much for.  Everyone brought a sincerity to their characters that really showed through.  It's a slow movie, but it's never boring or dull.  Every moment has something that contributes to the whole, and regardless of your situation in life, it's full of moments that you can relate to.

It *is* a sad movie - you can't help but sympathize with the main character, and even as a guy, there's plenty of times the eyes water up.  But there's some shockingly sudden hilarious moments that will have you bark out loud with laughter, totally unexpectedly.

The journey she takes in healing after her husband's death is so well portrayed.

Great movie, and if you're a guy with a significant other, it's one you can score bonus points for renting, and you may just find that you enjoy yourself as well.

Although I fell in love with the cast as soon as it started! I can honestly say there wasn't 1 moment that I just wished "Is it over yet?" I really don't go 4 chick flicks. Although, I've gotta say that I am glad that I did actually checked this 1 out! I wasn't real sure about "the energy" between those 2-really,not that I don't like Hillary Swank! But just like most chick flicks-make sure U grab plenty of tissue! B-)

I have loved this movie for a long time and decided I wanted to watch it, when... low and behold, my DVD collection didn't include this movie! AHHH! I immediately went to Amazon and purchased the blu-ray. If you're on the fence about buying this movie, take the plunge. It's lighthearted and sentimental all at the same time--you'll laugh through the tears! LOVE IT!
I don't know how they come up with movies this sensational I only wish I had half their talent. I love this movie.
i JUST WANTED TO HAVE A COPY BECAUSE i LOST THE COPY i HAD ON DVR-I REALLY LIKE THIS MOVIE AND FEEL SAFER NOW WITH A COPY IN MY HANDS
This is a prefect love story. How a person can love someone beyond your death. Even when you are dead that person Happiness is the most important thing to you. P.S I Love It.
I love this movie! It came right on time. The DVD works great, it does not freeze. Watched it 5x already :)

Has it's moments. Good soundtrack and great looks of beautiful Ireland. But its pretty much too far over-the-top.

The attempted connection with Harry Connick Jr. was pretty disgusting.

This is one of those movies where you think it's your standard chick flick but within the first 20 minutes it becomes an intense swept film.

The acting is great, Lisa Kudrow plays her usual character, but this is one of her better times soon so.

Hilary Swank was convincing and Butler was perfection.

Not just a chick flick good for all.
Everytime I watch this movie it makes me laugh, cry and makes me believe in true love.  I think everyone who has every loved someone should watch it.
Beautifully acted and directed.  Great scenery.  A good New York movie.  The soundtrack for P.S. is a mix of Irish and current songs.
Yes, I guess this would be considered a chick flick, but a very good one. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys feel good movies. Gerard Butler at his finest as well as the rest of the cast.

My friend was not about to get this movie at our Walmart.  I guess it is real popular and so they are sold out.
I was able to get it reasonable through you and she enjoys it very much.
I loved it one of the best movies I have seen incredible actors something I watch over and over heartwarming
i bought this for a friend and still don't regret it. we watch it every time it is such a great film
This is a really good love story.  Everyone should have this DVD in their collection.  It's truly a good love story.

I loved this movie. When it arrived, it was on time, and the DVD was unscratched and it's original case. Even though the case had a small dent/rip, I think it was definitely worth it and I am very happy with this purchase.
I liked the soundtrack as well as the story. One of the few movies i can watch more than once.

This movie is a real tearjerker. I liked the plot very much. It deals with grief and how society or family expects young widowed people to deal with the grief. It also deals with guilt and regret: the thing we wish we would have done or said to our loved ones before their tragic and untimely death. It is a film that makes you think about your loved ones, about not taking them for granted. It is a beautiful movies. I wish I had discovered this movie before I became widowed at a young age.

----Larry
WAS GIVEN AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT.  RECIPIENT LOVES ROMANTIC MOVIES AND THIS ONE IS VERY GOOD AND TO THE MARK.

The worst contrivance I've seen in awhile. Ordinarily, I get a lump in my throat during commercials. There was no surprise here, to me.  Not a tear was shed.  I almost wish I had bought the physical copy so I could throw it out.

I swear I'm not heartless. I just thought this was really bad.

A wonderful love story, sprinkled with self fulfillment. The movie not only focuses on romantic love, but also on motherly, sisterly love as well as friendship.  Funny, touching, a little gem with great actors..  Especially Hillary Swank.  Carpe diem and carpe the ones you love.
I purchased this before and lost it.  This is  great story that makes you laugh and makes you cry.  The acting is great.  I may watch this a couple or more times a year.

Por qué las personas esperamos a que nuestros seres queridos mueran para darnos cuenta lo importantes que son para nuestras vidas?  Esta es una de las películas más impactantes y hermosas que he visto donde se analiza las reacciones de una persona y el cómo la vida continua después de la muerte de un ser amado.  Es hermosa, la recomiendo.
This was a delightful movie. Lovely story line with a good ending.  Excellent if you want a good cry. Excellent acting
Great price for a great movie. It came in regular time in the mail, and was a wonderful addition to my romcom collection
We love watching this movie at home. It never gets old and I can't wait to watch it over and over again.

A friend highly recommended this film, and with nearly five stars, I thought - why not? I didn't actually read the reviews, but maybe I should have. It might have prepared me for the emotional tug-of-war that was about to ensue.

This is definitely one of those movies that reminds you of your own humanity. If you haven't cried in a while and wonder if it's even possible to cry, watch this. You'll be surprised at how easily you connect to the characters (and, therefore, crumble with them) as they move through the various stages of grief from different perspectives (first person as the heroine herself, or third person as her family/friends/neighbors).

If you've ever been in one of these positions, you'll understand why this film got such great reviews. It's not a feel-good make-you-happy film, it's a reminder that life is precious, and we're all in this together. Enjoy it, the message is priceless.
IM GIVING IT 5 STARS BECAUSE THIS IS MY BABES, FAVORITE LOVE STORY..... SO, THIS WILL BE ONE OF HIS MANY EXTRA SPECIAL CHRISTMAS GIFTS 2012....

The movie was delivered fairly quick, always seems to take longer when you want something fast, but it ws delivered just as seller stated. The quality is great, brand new DVD, nothing damaged,  GREAT MOVIE GREAT LOW PRICE

I decided to give it a four star because with all the reviews I thought this movie was going to be the best movie ever. The theme was not as I expected and I definitely have seen better movies than this one. Try it yourself and rate as your mind sees it.
I love this movie I fell in love with it a few years back and figured I would get it on blu-ray

I'm just a sucker for romantic comedies and this had it all.  This is a movie I would buy and watch over and over when I had the time.  It's a feel good movie, although the story is sad, it does have a great ending.

There aren't very many movies I can watch more than once but this is one of them. I love the music, the location(s) where the movie is filmed, and also the story line which most peoples lives have weaved in and out of in real life.

Interesting Premise Good Acting and some beautiful scenery but this has very serious overtones I would not call it a comedy but that being said it not a bad movie and I think Harry Connick may steal the movie. Kathy Bates is also very good as the mother Worth a look
I bought this as a stocking stuffer for my daughter.  We have always loved it! Great story about moving on after a tragedy.....
I laughed and cried and thoroughly enjoyed this movie. Great movie for a girls night or for the young girl (duaghter, Niece, etc.) in your life. Add it to your gift list.
This is one of the best romantic comedies of all time.  It makes you laugh, and it makes you bawl.  Make sure and watch the deleted scenes too!
What a great movie. Funny, romantic, and just plain entertaining, not to mention Gerard Butler AND Jeffrey Dean Morgan. Oh, my. Kathy Bates is wonderful, as always, as the mother.

Although I generally love a well produced "sappy" movie. I had a difficult time with this one. Worth watching...but only once. This movie simply went way too far into hardcore "chick movie" land for most tastes.
This movie was very emotional, funny and sad. Actors did a good job on playing their parts in a way to keep you interested.

Excellent movie. Great true love story with a complete twist.
If you loved The Notebook then you will love "P.S. I Love You".
It is a good movie. It shipped fast. And I would recommend it to a friend, family member, or another shopper.
this is a great movie and so worth watching with your significant other!!!! Hillary is amazing! And the friendships between the 3 women characters are very seet and very real

This is a sweet story about love that transcends death. Hillary Swank is her usual terrific self and her GFs Gina Gershon and Lisa Kudrow are very complementary to her character. Kathy Bates and Harry Connick Jr are terrific support. Gerard Butler is, well, Gerard Butler. He's got great comic timing and is, of course, adorable.
This is an amazing love story. It is very sad, but the adventure makes you smile. I bawl my eyes out every time I watch it. Great movie! such a neat story.
Love Love Love this movie. One of my all-time favorites. It is such a well written film and a beautiful love story.
One of my all time favorite movies.  A true love story.  It sucks you in and by the end after all the tears you have a smile on your face.
I love this movie and I usually do not like romance movies.  So funny and sweet and Gerard Butler is not bad either!

Just a beautifully presented movie of a very sad experience of a young woman.  Having experienced a similar loss of my wonderful husband, I could identify with her emotions.  I thought that it was very well done.

I'm not the greatest movie reviewer.  I'll be honest about that up front.  I tend to watch movies purely for my enjoyment and will usually rate it based on that alone.  I rarely judge the acting, the script, the development of plot, etc.  I really enjoyed watching this movie because it had "a little of everything"--something I personally need in a movie.  It made me laugh and cry.  It had seriousness and lightheartedness. The only disconnect I had was at the beginning of the movie.  The plot seemed to make a jump and I was left with a few questions.  I wondered if I missed something in the first 20 minutes of the movie.  Overall, though, it was a movie that I'd watch again and recommend to my girlfriends.  Not sure if it'd be a movie my hubby would watch with me, though.
I had already seen this movie prior to purchase. If you enjoy romantic movies this is a great one, a bit sad, but well worth watching.
After I lost my boyfriend, I received lots of signs he was still with me..... I never saw him however, a friend saw this and recommended I see it. OMG I cried and cried, what perfect timing!

P.S. I Love You is a good and well-thought out movie. I've never been a huge fan of Hilary Swank but I really enjoy her performance as recent widow, Holly. A lot of romantic comedies are pretty predictable but not this one. It has a happy beginning, a sad middle, and a hopeful ending. My only gripe with this movie is Harry Connick Jr. Seems like he is always being the jerk. I just can't relate to him and he tends to overact. P.S. I Love You will leave you pleasantly surprised, definitely one to watch!
Instant classic that didn't get near enough attention when it was released. Highly recommend for any man, woman, couple, young or old. Very well done, very well written.
Really a good movie, wish I could be so creative when my time comes. A must see with your girl
This is one of my favorite movies - cannot go wrong with this one.  Of course there are sad parts, however, the majority of the movie was laugh-out-loud funny!

This review is not about the film, but about the packaging and quality of the item itself. The DVD was packaged well, no scratches, and was just as I remembered when I had seen it in theaters. Great purchase!
P.S. I love you has a very strong story and great acting from Hillary Swank and Geard Butler, but unfortunately this BluRay Disc is sorely lacking special features
It's a very touchy feeling movie, I don't usually cry but this one made me. I truly admire their love and especially his.
This was an excellent romantic movie. Sad but very sweet story about a couple who shared a deep unselfish love

Great movie...saw it on TV and just had to buy it. It's a love story, a comedy, a tear jerker and hopeful. Loved the characters,and the actors where great...twists and turns. Makes one hopeful that love is always there in some shape or form.  Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.
I was very pleased. The disk was in great shape and the cover was in good shape. I could read the cover.
This one may have a sad base, but the story told is an enjoyable tear-jerker.  Have a box of kleenex next to you and enjoy!

always loved Judy but when I saw her sing in kinda tandem with Hillary to parallel a deep loss of love it spoke to me like never before, what a powerful performance!!!  I know this is about Gerry n Holly but everyone else makes do with their incisive comments... I found Gerry to be resurrected to walking on water, EVERY single scene with him looking so loving, handsome, and most of all seXy....  who is married after 10yrs in NYC and sees every memory sooooo saccarine syrupy overkill... we get it, Butler looks better than he did in his first foray well over 15yrs ago... thought Mom was too bitter in the you will always be alone and this memorial project was a waste, geez, thanks for the support in only her FIRST year of grieving, glad she got over her absolute love of her life in less than a year, bravo! and seems like the only thing they all do is go out and party, guess to show off her shoes???  Marie Antoinette did the same thing with less spectacular results, but hey this is 2008, so when someone has their health, a good business, friends and close relationship with her daughter I am sposed to just fall to pieces when she can't have everything?? ack.... I did find the film with many redeeming qualities, given how much I enjoy Hills, Gerry, Kathy, Harry, Gina, hmmmm, Lisa I can do without..... esp. the trip to the Green Isle, wow, thanks for those visuals, mostly all attractive men, PTL, and the happy ending was quaint finishing touch to the last letter, and yeah the tongue lashing at the harpie in the real estate deal was theee best!!!

This is an awesome love story, any girl would be lucky to find someone to love them as Jerry loved Holly. Get out your tissues, turn out all the lights, turn off the phone and get ready to be mesmerized.
This was a romantic, and sad at times, but uplifting movie.  I really enjoyed it.  Men would consider this a 'chick flick', but it is well worth watching!
This is sad movie about a spouse dying, but a touching one. You watch the progress of time and emotion after someone losses their life partner.
This movie is the perfect movie about true love & how it can span all areas. A must watch for the romantic! Get your tissue....you will cry!
Everyone knows and loves this movie, but watching it again years later, laughing and crying, made me fall in love with it all over again.  And to get the Blue Ray at this price was pure bonus!

This movie is awesome for couples to watch :) . The movie lets you realize how precious life is. Its very mushy so guys i would decide to watch this with just your girl and you snuggled together.  But also very funny as well :)
Love love love this movie.  Wish I had someone that loved and cared for me that much that was willing to make such a difficult time a little easier with so much creativity!
Great love story, make you think twice about the time we waste bickering over nothing. Im a big Gerald Butler fan.
I simply adore this movie.  It's funny, sad, silly, and sexy, thanks to Gerard Butler and JEFFREY DEAN MORGAN!!! I have watched this movie many times already and I'm certain I will many more.  :-D

Didn't get very far in this movie.  The first scene was okay.  The second scene I couldn't even get past.  The memorial service is pretty cheesy, but very "New York."  If you like seeing a memorial service at a bar with lots of weird people around, this just may be  your sort of movie...

Maybe I was just not in the right mood.

"Watch it with a box of Tissues"
Hillary Swank plays Holly, Gerald Butler plays Gerry, an American woman that falls in love and marries an Irishman. Gerry and Holly's love is wonderful but Gerry dies of a brain tumor. Gerry knowing his wife knows that she needs help and a little push to get over his death and move on. Gerry sends Holly letters to help her do that, making her do things she wouldn't normally do. Each letter is signed P.S. I Love You.

I loved this movie, started off a little slow, but the wonderful man I married (who I secretly wish had that Irish accent) watched it with me. Total chick flick, but a real man can watch it too. I loved the romance that played out the ending was great, tears flowed and smiles, and laughter!!!
I really enjoyed this movie... I bought the book too. I am hoping that the parts that I loved about the movie will be even greater in the book.  Hillary Swank was fantastic!
This is a great romantic comedy.  A nice story line of losing someone close to you and the struggles of moving on.

well this movie came out 5yrs ago, I jusr saw it last night first time. I love Hillary Swank & Gerad Bulter in this movie usually movies like this aren't that good But I Was Pleasantly Surprized!! with this one!! I Liked it VERY Much! MADE me Cry, But I LOVED it!!

I can't say that many movies make me cry, but this one did! it has great acting and is such a heartwarming story. I gave this to my mother for Mother's Day and she loved it. I'ts definitely a film worth watching.

I have never cried this much at a movie probabaly because i don't watch a lot of tear jerkers but this got me good. It is very engaging. I could not be more infatuated with Gerard Butler. He is the only reason i rented this movie.
AWESOME I love this movie one of the best love stories ever told.  I would recommend this product to all that are looking to buy them.

I think if you watch the movie without reading the book, then you'll like the movie a lot.  However, if you're like me and love to read the books behind movies, you will be very disappointed with this movie.  If you liked the movie and want to go more into depth with the story, I would read the book!  The best part of the movie was Gerard Butler - definitely made the movie.  I just can't really see him falling for Hilary Swank though; she's too manly looking!  She is a great actress though...just casting could have been better.

P.S. I love you is a great movie! I was looking for a little more laughter and not so many tears though. Make sure you have plenty of Kleenex ready for this one! Even though it wasn't exactly what I was looking for, I can still say it was definitely worth the money and time invested in it. Hope you enjoy it as much as I did!!! :0) I received the movie promptly and I will continue to order from them. I love ordering from amazon!
Bought this for my college age daughter.  One of her favorites...chick flick. Get the Kleenex for the crying and the laughing.

Purchased the sound track believing that all the songs that are in the movie would be on the CD, THEY ARE NOT! Actually, it pissed me off! The two songs that I really loved are not on the freakin CD, WTF?

Hell, the Pulp Fiction has everything on it including discussions between Samuel Jackson and John Travolta - How a SOUND TRACK should be!

Songs we loved and purchased the CD for and they are no where to be found!

1. Gerard Butler - "Galway Girl".
2. The funeral song!

Now, I have to figure out how to get these elsewhere. A real bummer.
Again, I also purchased this for friend but watched a while back.  Very touching, moving, as weel as hysterical.  Perfect for women...and probably quite a few men.
This was a gift for my daughter-in-law and she is very happy with it.  she loves this movie and it is one of her favorites.

First, if you read the book (I did not), don't expect the movie to match this - here's the thing THEY NEVER DO, EVER. I read Stephen King books, watch some the movies, the movies are never as good as the books because a movie budget cannot match our imaginations. Secondly, if you know you don't like Swank or Butler - then just don't watch the movie to begin with, but don't watch it and then complain about how much you can't stand to watch them. This is a great movie - people are so used to the ending that they expect (ie Swank ending up with Connick) that they can't appreciate a movie that deviates from thier expectations. I didn't see that they had any chemistry to begin with anyway. I love him as a musician and actor, but thier characters had no spark together and this was apparent from the beginning, it was right that they didn't end up together. Jeffrey Dean Morgan is adorable, him and Swank go great together. I also find it funny that people will complain about how this movie "wasted thier time" etc, if so - why write a 3 page review about it? Isn't that wasting more time? Move on.
a little sad but also very good and inspiring. don't wanna spoil the story but if you can't take a some sadness in your movie watching don't go for this movie. otherwise i really like it
This is definitely a chick flick which I'm not into most of the time but I love this movie and got it for a great price on Amazon.
Love this movie!  From the gorgeous Mr. Butler, his singing, his wit, the beautiful scenery (Ireland)and touching love letters, this movie has it all.

Such an amazing and sad beginning. I accidentally forgot I watched it already and started watching it again and then I remembered.....it's a good movie to watch. It will make you think and love the ones you love even more.

Cleverly written and beautifully acted, this movie would appeal to just about anyone, I think.  I give it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the Yankee stadium scene.  There are a couple of scenes that were deleted that I think would have made it a better film if they had been included instead of the Yankee stadium scene.

Hillary Swank is great in this movie and she's not alone.  The entire cast was fantastic.  This movie runs the gamut of emotional highs and lows.  It is funny and tragic, devastating and hopeful.  You will not go wrong by deciding to watch this one.

On second thought, I'm gonna five it 5 stars because I enjoyed it so much.  Even with the scene I think could have been done much better.  :)

Love this movie. One of the few I could watch over and over. Kind of like re-reading favorite parts of  "The Princess Bride" by William Goldman, and still smiling and finding it humorous. When you love something, you want to experience it again and again. Perhaps I love it because I've lost so many loved ones in the past seven years, and this movie is all about love and loss and dealing with life when you just don't think you can get out of bed. It's a story of a flawed woman who despite her flaws, is truly loved. About a man who reaches beyond the grave and helps her to deal with life again.

There's realism to this movie--not just a smooth, easily flowing, wrap it all up by the end type of movie, although there is a bit of that too. This one is somewhat messy and disjointed along the way. Again, just like real life. Ups, downs, laughter, crying, some weirdness thrown in. Unexpected in places, awkward in others. If you've lost someone you love, this movie carries you along, and leaves you in a better place mentally and emotionally than where you started. How many movies do that?

Usually I can't stand movies of this sort ("The Notebook", "A Walk in the Clouds", etc.), but I must say I was pleasantly surprised after watching this film.

A friend of mine brought it to my home one evening for a girl-talk + manicure session, and an inner part of me groaned...

"Oh no -- here comes cheesiness..."

I felt guilty for looking down on this movie before even watching it, because after thoroughly enjoying it I realized how wrong a person can be when he or she jumps to naive conclusions.

Is this story cheesy? In many ways, yes. Movies of this sort usually are.

BUT -- the reason why this movie overcomes its groan factor is because Hillary Swank and Gerard Butler are so believable. I didn't think they'd have much chemistry, but they make the story work.

I won't ruin the movie for you, but it's a cute story that leaves one with pangs of longing for something beautifully similar to happen to herself.

`P.S. I Love You' is a strange film in that it manages to be both funny and sad at the same time.

When Holly loses her husband, Gerry, to a brain tumour she really struggles to come to terms with her loss.  Then on her 30th birthday she receives the first of many letters from Gerry that he wrote before he died.  These comfort and guide her through her grief and set her back on the path of her life again.

This film has some genuinely funny moments, some of which come from Lisa Kudrow, and one minute you will be feeling choked up from a particular scene, only to be laughing in the next.  Swank is ok as Holly and Gerard Butler is good as Gerry, but I have to say one of the stronger performances comes from Kathy Bates, which is no surprise whatsoever as she always is a class actress.

This has some wonderful flash backs of Holly and Gerry's early relationship and some of the surprise's he springs on her in the letters are poignant and heartfelt.  This is a bit of a `chick flick' (which is no criticism, more an observation), but it is done very well and despite being a little over-long, it is a touching enough film with an original storyline to keep you interested.  Some parts of this film are superfluous (like Harry Connick Jr's character who could easily be cut with no loss to the film), but I guess they add an extra dimension that would otherwise be lacking.

All in all this is an engaging and reasonably emotional film and it's gentleness is offset by it's humour, which makes for an entertaining combination.  This is worth a viewing at some point and makes a nice way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.

When Gerry (Gerard Butler) finds out he doesn't have much time left to live, he plans a sort of scavenger hunt for his beloved wife Holly (Hilary Swank). A few weeks after he passes away, Holly gets the first surprise in the mail, and each surprise leads to another letter from her deceased husband. Some of Gerry's messages force her to go out and spend time with her friends, thereby taking her out of mourning and letting her enjoy everything beautiful about life that she had forgotten about.

Indeed, I thought it was a beautiful story. I know some reviewers said it was very predictable, and while you do get the idea that Holly is slowly moving on to bigger and better things, the story is not that obvious otherwise. At times, Holly feels like relapsing and going back to depression; at other times, we find out a surprise about herself or one of her friends. People who love romantic comedies will find this movie adorable; people who do not will still find it bearable.

And the concept behind what Gerry did is great too. Surprises for a sad person can be helpful in lifting them up. And while you shouldn't cling on to the past too tightly, letters from a loved one who is gone are a wonderful keepsake to remember them.

This is a truly enjoyable movie if you are a sucker for a good romance story like I am. The story is really about true love and how it can continue on after death. It is also a story of a husband who over time gives his surviving wife the ability to move on with her life as she is currently familiar with. There are moments when I wanted to cry, laugh, and just think about the story of this movie and imagine that something like this really could happen. The movie at times leave you anxious  during the middle part of the movie but aren't unexpected movie endings something all viewers crave? You will get that and more in P.S. I love you. After I watched I thought this is a 3 star movie but thinking about it a day later I realized there are not many films out there that can grab every sense of emotion you have and pull you along for the ride. So it is a post movie 5 star rating. Enjoy P.S. I love you is a very good movie. Though the movie starts out in a long argument followed by complete confusion if you haven't read a review it tackles and tugs on every emotion a movie goer should have for this type of film. From a males perspective, it was a little tough to get into at first but the movie grows on you as it continues.

**1/2

Before he dies, Gerry Kennedy (Gerard Butler) - the pluckiest victim of a brain tumor since the stiff-upper-lipped Bette Davis faced-down a similar fate in "Dark Victory" - comes up with an ingenious way to continue giving Holly (Hilary Swank), his soon-to-be widow, advice from beyond the grave.  He composes a series of upbeat letters to be delivered to her at regular intervals after he`s gone - missives that contain specific instructions on how to pick up the pieces of her shattered world and move on with her life.  You see, Holly was kind of an uptight stick-in-the-mud when they were married, and now the too-good-to-be-true, happy-go-lucky Irishman wants to loosen her up by getting her to perform karaoke, sending her on an all-expenses-paid trip to the place of his birth, and encouraging her to become a cobbler (I kid you not).  But will Gerry's continued presence in his widow's life actually retard her ability to let go of the past and start anew?  And does this "Ghost" knockoff stand a ghost of a chance of becoming as universally beloved as that earlier husband-hanging-around-after-death romantic classic?

Beyond the cringe-inducing creepiness of its premise, "P.S. I Love You," based on the novel by Cecilia Ahern, is one of those annoying romantic comedies in which the women get all goofy, frisky and/or tongue-tied the moment some good-looking guy so much as steps into their line of vision.  Moreover, Gerry is portrayed as such a saintly figure, both before his demise and most definitely thereafter, that we never get to know him as a real, flesh-and-blood person in his own right; instead, in order to make all the ladies in the audience swoon over his magnificent romantic spirit - one, I might add, that no man in the real world has the slightest hope of ever living up to - writer/director Richard LaGravenese has seen fit to deprive Gerry of all those flaws each of us is entitled to just for being a member of the human race - and which are truly the only things that make a character interesting in the end.  And with that crucial dimension missing from the couple's relationship, we soon lose interest in Holly as well.  And, of course, the movie cheats by having Gerry's illness take place entirely off-camera, so as not to disturb the light romantic tone of the piece, but it does little to make us care about the couple.  The movie finally hits on some honest sentiment round about the 115-minute mark, and the story does avoid going down one painfully obvious narrative pathway towards the end, but, by that time, it's much too late to undo the damage.

A large cast of well-known and talented actors - Kathy Bates, Lisa Kudrow, Harry Connick Jr., among them - do yeomen work with poorly written parts, but it's an uphill slog against bathos, pratfalls and contrivance all the way.  Well, at least the Irish scenery is lovely.

Pass on Swank, although I realize the Director, and others, rule.  But horribly miscast. Pass on the script.  Pass on the direction.  The supporting cast was there, talented, and ready to work and they got the shaft.

I can hear the Director:  "Kathy, Lisa please be your sterotypes."
Please, actors:  save your money so that you can turn down wretched roles.

Apart from that, I am appalled that women reviewers like this film.  If you are really like this Holly character, then we're all doomed.

I just got finished watching this movie that I just rented here on Amazon.  Gerard Butler is one of my favorite actors of all time. Actually because of The Phantom of the Opera, he is my favorite actor of all time.  This was one of very few of his that I never seen before so I had to see it.

This film is a very, very sad film and it made me cry actually.  The very beginning of the film, you see that Gerard Butler has died and I couldn't believe how quick it was into the film.  Not even ten minutes and he's gone.  I really loved how it showed her grief for him and you could tell how much she really loved him.  He obviously really loved her too to go through the act of having her mother send her all the letters from him which you don't learn it's from her until the end of the film.  I loved all the flashbacks and I really started to cry from that moment when she returns from Ireland and go to her mother and cries and they go to the park and she gets the last letter and has Connick Jr.  read aloud the last letter.  What's written in the last letter is so sad and emotional.

To be honest, I never knew before I saw this film that Gerard dies in the beginning.  I never knew the plot and obviously never read the book.  So I was really expecting a romantic comedy and thought they would be together in the end.  But I was wrong and even though it's not what I expected, the fact that this film was able to move me, make me cry and I could relate to how she was in the grieving sense, I highly recommend at least a rental.  It's very emotional and sad.  I really enjoyed it.  And Ireland's scenery is gorgeous!

The best parts of this film were the scenes with Butler and Swank together -- both before his death and afterward via flashback.  Especially fresh was the scene when they first meet in Ireland (via flashback), and when Swank meets Butler's parents.  I would have liked to see the couple's relationship develop from the beginning, rather than using a contrived death and the business with the constant letters, which to me, got in the way of how these characters actually felt toward each other.  When one tells a story it is usually recommended as being more effective when one shows how, rather than tells how.....and the letters made it into a story that is told rather than one that is shown...the flashbacks SHOW how their romance began, and that is why they are so appealing and interesting.  Butler and Swank have plenty of star power, sex appeal, and certainly the acting chops for these roles.  The contrived letters took up so much time that I finished the film wishing it had had a more conventional plot.....if she had gone over to Ireland to see him before their marriage, meet his family, and so on, the actors had enough skill to make that fresh and new, but perhaps that has been done to death; at least they did not make the Irish look like yokels or buffoons; Gerry's parents seemed incredibly real, open, considerate, and sweet, and it would have been interesting to see Gerry with his parents, but we are not given that chance.  And Swank's delight in realizing that they did not hate her for "taking Gerry away from them" to live stateside was quite nice and refreshing.  None of the "Meet the Fokkers" stale stupidity in these scenes whatsoever.  Also the ending, where Swank and Bates arrive in Ireland was nifty.  Why did they not do more of that, develop that?  Instead we got the usual ditsy Lisa Kudrow (not my favorite) doing her usual innane thing -- who wants to watch Kudrow when you have Swank and Butler?  They only acted together for about 15 minutes at the beginning and end.  I just felt the plot was contrived to squeeze as many tears out of the audience as possible and I was hoping for more showing how their relationship developed.  Hope to see Butler in many more romantic comedies.  His comedic, romantic skills are SO appealing and his talents wasted in action flicks (300?  DOH!!  So ridiculous.)  I thought Swank was credible in a feminine lead, however, except in the flashback scene in Ireland at the end where they first meet, she seems mostly cranky in her scenes with Butler, which makes one wonder why his character would put up with her, since she seems to spend most of her time complaining and picking fights.  Why would such a happy-go-lucky guy like Gerry even stay with someone who constantly finds fault?  She was so sweet and open when they first met in Ireland, and willing to go along with the mad-dog story Gerry was giving her even though she knew the sheep dog was tame.....it would have been cute to go more with that lightness.  I would also have loved to see how her shoe designs grew out of her life with Gerry and her delight in him....  Kathy Bates was terrific; Harry Connick creepy -- a weird character who one minute was acting logically, and loaded with self-respect and a clear view of himself, and the next blurting innanities and acting depressed and self-defeating.  Why was his character even IN the film?  I cannot see how his character moved the plot forward at all.  Just some thoughts.

I got sucked into this movie when it was recently broadcast on TV - I had read some terrible reviews when it came out, didn't like the previews, and wasn't interested in seeing it at all.  I think the music initially captured my attention the other night on TV but I was drawn into this movie and loved it.  A weepy that's for sure, and while very funny at times, I would not say it's a romantic comedy.  Reflecting on the movie I can see that the supporting characters are not very three dimensional, and of course it's all rather unbelievable if you think about it too much, but the acting was great, music great, I bought it all the whole time I was watching.  It does make you think about your relationships with friends and spouse, and think about how you treat people in life as if they are always going to be there until suddenly they are not.  For a supposedly light weight film, that's pretty good.  I didn't find it creepy or icky as some people have - I thought it was thought provoking in questioning what  is the "best" or "right" way to deal with the death of a loved one.  And I'm buying the film because I'd like to watch it again, experience the characters again, and hear the great music and see great shots of Ireland.

I must admit I had fairly low expectations for this film, as I was not a big fan of Freedom Writers (Full Screen Edition), the work of the previous partnership between Hillary Swank and director Richard LaGravenese. I was also mixed about Gerard Butler as a romantic lead...thought he was borderline cartoonish in the Katherine Heigl vehicle The Ugly Truth (Widescreen Edition) but very effective as 'The Stranger' in the underrated Dear Frankie. With that backdrop, I was very pleasantly surprised by this film. I underestimated the impact of the Hillary Swank Likability Quotient. [Her inherent likability being one of the big factors in her two Oscar wins.] The opening scene of the movie is a revelation - a very well done 10-minute or so extended dialogue between Swank and Butler that presents the current state of their relationship about 11 years in. The movie then goes forwards and backwards in time from there. The quality of the acting is set in that first scene though - Hillary Swank's uncommon attractiveness and standout acting together with Gerard Butler's charm and ease of manner make for real chemistry. As compared to, say, the fairly dreadful Did You Hear About the Morgans? where I wouldn't have imagined Sarah Jessica Parker and Hugh Grant's characters together in a thousand years, you could fully envisage these two as a couple. LaGravenese only strengthens that by providing you the back story of their relationship as the movie progresses. When you finally get back to when the two characters first meet, you can see how and why Butler was immediately smitten. One casting note: Gerard Butler and Jeffrey Dean Morgan - a Scot and Yank respectively - are the two leading Irishmen. Seriously? They're both good, but not a single Irishman could be rounded up for either of these roles? The DVD Extras were a bit disappointing - no "making of" vignette (a little odd - usually a sign of people disassociating themselves from a film of questionable quality, which can't be the case here). But kudos for a neat little (and kitschy) primer on "The Name of the Game is Snaps." I also have to make a snarky comment about the summary of the movie on the DVD sleeve found inside my red envelope (hint, hint). The first line of the summary states that Swank's character is Dublin-based. Huh? Do these synopsis-izers even watch these movies?

However, she deals with it in a unique way...via letters from him.  The charm and mystery of the movie is watching her heal, move on, and wondering how she is getting the letters. I have seen this movie a few times with my wife and while I don't have to make over dramatized gag motions I certainly don't look forward to seeing it.  While the twist of an Irish side to the movie does add some changes to what could be a fairly cliche storyline I am not amazed.  The acting is well done and the storyline does follow a consistent path, mainly humor is the key in this flick.  There are several awkward situations of laughter that bring this closer to enjoyable.  It is not a bad movie but it's just not my personal choice, it would seem to be one of the better films in this genre.  But for those of us who have to see these it is a welcome change to not be getting elbowed in the ribs by our significant other as we have to poke fun after each less than clever line.

Whoever dredged up the concept for this movie must either be desperate or sick, or both.  The thought of receiving frequent letters from your dead partner over the space of a year after his death is a slap in the face for grief, common sense and mental health.  That a reviewer (someone from 'Westwood One' - who the heck are they ?) endorsement on the front cover of the Blu-Ray is quoted as describing this as 'The best romantic comedy in a very long time' defies belief ! If I had been able to see that sole 'official' review on the case I would never have made the purchase.  Remember, if they can only get a positive review for publicity from someone/somewhere you've never heard of, caveat emptor applies. BEWARE !

This movie is neither romantic nor remotely funny.  The Amazon official review warns you to have tissues on standby - they are not for tears, rather your stomach contents as you wade your way through this tasteless and unfunny film.  Did it even have a theatrical release ?  I'd be surprised, as in my opinion, it doesn't even deserve a straight to DVD release.

There seems little point in commenting on the acting as the script and concept are so repugnant you don't even notice the actors that much.

Not only was this tasteless it was also extremely boring.  How this could be described as a romantic comedy is beyond my comprehension.  How others can swoon over it is also beyond my understanding, as this film trawls the bottom-of-the-genuinely-tasteless barrel.

One star, as you cannot leave less - although I would sincerely like to !

P.S. I love you is a good movie, and this DVD comes with deleted scenes and a commentary (which I have yet to watch!) I don't typically like chick flicks, but I am a fan of this movie. The deleted scenes were awesome too!
What an original movie! I loved all the parts and loved the whole cast and characters.
This a a story that touches your heart and can be watched over and over again.
I ended up using the Movie as a Dirty Santa gift with a bunch of ladies. It was a great gift all the ladies I know LOVE this movie.
After watching this movie at a friends house I decided to buy it for my mom for Christmas. She loved it! This movie is great! It's sad too so grab a box of kleenex before watching it. :-)
Overall a good romance movie. For those who cry easily, I recommend some tissues. I love gerard butler, and he was great. I wasn't a huge fan of her, but she did an OK job.

This is a heartbreaking yet cute story of a woman still in love with her dead husband, who left behind a series of letters and missions that he wants her to accomplish.  Of course, life continues, and there are friends and family and other men for her to deal with at the same time.  It's rather predictable, I suppose, but nice to watch for the locations in Ireland, as well as for Butler, Bates, Morgan, and Swank.
The movie is one of my favourites I love the story soo romantic. The dvd worked great!
Thanks, the dvd arrived right on time and in great condition.  I've enjoyed viewing it many times.  Thnaks again for great service.
Funny movie with sad and moving parts. How to move on after a loss without getting totally lost - loved it

I loved the book, I laughed with Holly, I cried with her, it was just so moving.  Being a young newlywed myself I could not imagine losing my husband so soon as she did; and having the strength to move on with life..  I could not stop talking about this book to my husband, as I finished reading for a day I would tell him what was happening.  He will not read a book, so I thought we could watch the movie together (he is good that way, he will watch chick flicks with me).  Boy was that the biggest mistake ever!!  I hated the movie, it was nothing like the book at all!!  I was embarrased to have asked my husband sit through those 2 wasted hours that we will never get back.  I can't imagine liking this movie even if I hadn't read the book.  Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time on this movie

Yes, you read it right in the subject line...I am a regular 28 year old guy who lifts weights, plays video games from time to time, etc. That being said I could not stop crying through this movie. My girlfriend and I watched it together and it just makes you well up with emotion over and over again. It brings to light some poignant truths: that life is short, not to be pedantic (don't let the little things get to you), Love and cherish the people who are special to you. I never particularly cared for Hillary Swank before this (I think it all started when she played "the next karate kid" lol) but now I really like her as an actress. It's such a beautiful movie with a beautiful love story that ended too soon, but such is life...rarely ever fair. "Carpe Diem and remember the important things because they may be gone before you know it" once again are the messages this movie sends. I highly recommend it to anyone.

This was an excellent movie. My new favorite romantic comedy. Hilary Swank is a two-time Oscar winner who proves that she can do romantic fluff as well as the next leading lady. She has incredible chemistry with Gerard Butler, who has not been getting the best roles of his career. He is far underestimated, in my view, and I hope to see him in more romantic comedies.

I liked P.S. I Love You more than I thought I would but didn't love it. I absolutely hate being manipulated emotionally and that is what I expected but most of the relationship between Holly (Swank) and Gerry (Butler) is revealed through flashbacks. The movie starts with an annoying and somewhat amusing overtly long fight between the couple. The next scene shows his funeral so the viewer doesn't get too caught up in the story of them, ending up chewing fingernails in dread waiting for the moment the story changes in a bad way.

A feel good chick-flick where the heroine moves out of a rut, wins self-respect and becomes a better person for surviving pain.

A naked man backside parades across the screen and Lisa Kudrow's character plays the field like a talented trout fisherwoman...(is that PC?) tossing bait out and whipping it back, moving with the current til the prize fish bites. I wouldn't recommend it for family viewing or if you are annoyed by the genre.

It has been a while since I watched this movie, but anytime anyone asks for a recommendation, this is the first movie to come to mind. The story was beautifully told ... an honest, loving relationship ended by death ... but a love that carries on regardless.

Do yourself a favor and watch.
I love this movie...it is heart warming and fun. A good mixture of emotions.  Recommend it!
It made me cry more than what I was expecting. But a nice story line.
This is a wonderful movie, but beware, if you cry during movies have tissues ready!

This a LOVE story that is epic...a Love that transcends life.  Photography is wonderful...the scenes in Ireland are breath taking.  The acting and story line are outstanding.  Warning...this is not a 1 or 2 tissue movie...bring the box.  But is oh so worth it.

Touching to the point that I began crying from the moment of the wake.  Subsequently, I cried through the entire movie.  These weren't tears of sadness, they were the tears where you sigh and think Gerry is the most wonderful man to have ever lived, determined that his love for his wife (Holly) could still be shouted from the rooftops even after he has left. Holly's pursuit of Gerry's requests to help her through her grief and depression are at times funny and poignant and the photography is absolutely stunning!
Saw this movie on cable & had to buy it great story but sad because it talks about loss but the adventure during the movie is great.
Made my heart melt, my husband even liked it. Not one of his facvorites but he said it was good for a chick flick.

I was wary of watching this one -- I avoid what I consider "chick flicks" like the plague. But I knew part of it took place in Ireland, which I love, and -- well, Gerard Butler is a hunk. And a damn good actor -- as is everyone else in this cast. It is romantic, it is sentimental, but it's not "sappy." Definitely worth enjoying.
You will not believe how romantic this movie is! I have watched it five times. Everyone I've ever talked with has watched it more than once. It's a treasure for the romantics among us.

Quite enjoyable....loved it!! I've cried and laughed each time I watched this movie; I believe for about 7 times now! I decided to buy a copy so I can have my husband watch it with me. I also bought the CDs both John Powell(soundtrack) and Various Artists copies. I enjoy listening to them while I'm driving.
i'm happy to have my dvd. the price was great and i got it in record time. couldn't be happier.

Despite the fact that you'll cry, for sad and happy reasons, about 10 times throughout the movie, it's one of the most incredible "chick flicks" I've ever seen.  The characters are strange and hilarious, yet wonderfully relatable.  You'll have no doubt that no one could have loved Holly as much or as thoroughly as Gerry did.  I recommend it for everyone, no matter what movie genre you prefer.

This was a wonderful movie but you may need a few tissues to get you through it.  It's really touching and you won't be disappointed with the story line.  It's about a couple deeply in love and the husband dies leaving her to find her way without him.  It's moving, funny, adventurous, touches on mother/daughter conflicts, and, of course, romance.  This is one I will watch again and again.

I admit, I avoided this movie for a while because I do not particularly care for Hilary Swank. Finally one night, being alone, and with few options of movies to watch in the ON-DEMAND library, I decided to give it a go.

This is what I liked about it:
1. The story was mostly about Holly and Gerry, and was not the context of her next relationship.
2. I worried that his letters would only cause her to hold to his memory all the more, but was pleased to see how they freed her to continue her life.
3. Her grieving process was real. At the risk of sounding morbid, I have to say it pleased me to see her go through intense grief. It made her character more real and likable and also gave credit to the strength of their marriage.

This is why I only gave it three stars (if I could have given it a rating of 3.5, I would have):
1. This is a minor one--all those designer clothes from eBay? Yeah right.
2. (Spoiler alert) She does have a bit of a fling in the middle. Not to be a prude but I didn't really see it as adding anything to the story except for giving it a sex scene.
My husband does not usually like romantic movies... but he was moved and very touched by this one and had been recommending it to his friends!

The first time I watched it... I cried for about 87% of the movie.  It was about 5 minutes of crying, 1 minute of not crying through the whole movie.  I watched it a second time and it was about 30% crying...  Very good performances from everyone.

P.S. I Love You has become one of my favorite movies.  I saw it in the theater when it first came out, but being able to watch the DVD has made it really special.  The music and scenery are beautiful.  The movie runs the gamut of emotions from happiness to grief to hope not to mention just laughing out loud.  I ordered the book from which the movie was adapted and enjoyed it as well.
Delivery was really quick and quality of DVD I order is pretty good. Overall I am satisfied.

Since then, I have purchased a copy for my daughter and shown the movie to friends.  It's funny, tragic, and over all perfect!

This movie kind of seems to hate women. From the neurotic main character, the crass best friend, to the unreasonable but ultimately loving mom, all the women in this movie are really hard to relate to. The men on the other hand are all handsome, kind and insightful with token superficial flaws. They try to imply complex relationships but in the arguments I always end up siding with the guys because the women "don't know what they want" (as stated by female protagonist). I have to admit, it was genius giving the new love interest turrets so it wouldn't be socially unacceptable for him to move in on a widow. Though I love Nellie McKay, my girlfriend observed that it seemed like she was making fun of the movie. There were a lot weak rom-com cliches, and contrived drama when I was hoping for a movie that had the worst and best moments love has to offer. I feel like this movie at it's core had a lot of potential but it was just poorly executed.
I received my movie in great shape and was very pleased with my purchase.  I highly recommend this vendor.

I hadn't heard great things about this movie, but when I finally caught it on HBO, I thought... this movie is really cute, I wonder why it didn't get better reviews.  One night, I watched it again a second time and thought... this movie is really good.  And so, I bought the DVD.  Well, I've watched this movie at least half a dozen times since then and it never loses a beat, if anything, you catch more and more of the little bits that are really funny with each viewing.  Harry Connick, Jr. is adorable as the 'wants to be more than a friend' character and both Gina Gershon and Lisa Kudrow play off each other very well.  Hilary Swank and Gerard Butler had terrific chemisty (even though his role is played mostly in 'flashback' sequences...)  The scenery in Ireland is just beautiful and the lack of needing any foul language or gratuitous nudity or sex to make the movie interesting and funny is very refreshing.  Yes, it may be considered a 'chick flick', but I think anyone who needs a good laugh especially when life kicks you around a bit should buy this movie.
Fast shipping, good product. Exactly how it was described and came in the condition i expected it

Hilary Swank is such a versatile actress.  Is there a role she can't play well?  In PS - I Love You, she plays Holly, a young widow who's lost the love of her life to cancer.  Gerry, her husband, knows his death is going to be hard on her and arranges a year's worth of letters and gifts to be delivered to Holly at specific occasions.

The year sees Holly take an emotional roller coaster ride.  At time she completely withdraws and friends and family go from concern to just having enough of it and moving on without her.  In the end, with the last letter from Gerry telling her get on with it, and a heart to heart with her mom, Holly rejoins the world, reconnects with her friends and finds a new path for herself.

By no means am I very into chick flicks. But THIS movie is in my top favorite movies of all time. It's a classic love story that proves that love trancends death. It's been a LONG time since I've been this enchanted with a film.
Due to the sappy trailers, I avoided it on cable for months, but
finally sat down and watched it from beginning to end. Ever since
that first viewing, I've been hooked. I laugh every time, I cry every
time, I sit in awe every time, and enjoy each and every minute of this
lovely film, which I have since purchased on DVD.

What's to love? The movie seamlessly blends the story of the main
characters and their past with little confusion. The editing is almost
perfect. The cast is brilliant. Highest marks go to Gerard Butler and
Jeffrey Dean Morgan for their mastery of the dialect and their unbelievable
good looks and charm, as well as Harry Connick Jr., who nails the part of
the goofy, socially-challenged bartender. Though not a ravishing beauty,
Hillary Swank's performance is sympathetic and convincing, and Lisa
Kudrow and Gina Gershon are superb as her supportive sidekicks. Kathy
Bates also delivers a seamless performance as the grieving widow's mother.

What else is there to love? The movie's beautiful scenery. New York and glorious
Ireland are themselves characters in this lovely tale. I am also very partial
to the movie's soundtrack, the theme of which is bittersweet and romantic. Most
of all, you will love the film's whimsical and lighthearted approach to themes
that universally touch us all:  themes of love and loss, anger and confusion,
friendship and family, hope and despair. The storyline may be somewhat
implausible and there may be no husband on earth as charming and quiescent as
Gerard Butler's Gerry, but the mere suggestion that a man like he exists and that
the love he shares with Holly trancends his tragic death is worth the price of admission.

You don't have to be a "chick" or a sentimental sap to enjoy this movie. What you do need
is a heart. This film will surely touch it in all the right places. Five Stars!
This was a delightful comedy/love story.  Hilary Swank and Gerard Butler are well matched and I hope to see them paired in other films together.

How this movie escaped public acclaim in theater release is mysterious. Cute, intelligently romantic comedies usually find an audience before they are released to DVD. Although $53 million is a decent box office  gross (Notting Hill did twice that) almost no one ever saw this gem until it hit HBO. Experiencing it in 1080i made me convinced that 1080p would be spectacular and I was not disappointed.

The Irish scenes in particular, with their fields of wildflowers and greening meadows, are almost dreamlike. Such  cinematographic romanticism as a set for a tale of true love and discovery, makes PS I Love You a necessary buy for any decent Blu-ray library.

A high-strung young woman in love with her affable Irish husband realizes too late that she should have treasured her moments with him. His patient love reaches out beyond his untimely death to show her how to keep living, and to love again.

Great film by all means. Very romantic and sad at the same time.

Its about an American girl who was married to an Irish guy (Jerry) and they were both so much in love. Then, at the age of 35 he passed away from brain tumor.

Their relationship didn't end at that point. Before he died he prepared to her many letters that were planned to be sent in future dates. Letters asking her to sing at the Karoake (which she feared), reminding her of their beautiful moments together, planning trips for her with her friends, bringing her back to the place where they first met, and asking her to move on and fall in love with someone else.

She couldn't move on because she can't love anyone besides Jerry. She felt lonely many times. Her father left her and her mom at the age of 14, which made her promise herself to not be with any guy ever. Then she met Jerry who was a great man, but unfrotunately he died. She kept asking her self, why? What's the point?

In the end after facing the sad reality, she decided to move on. Actually, she probably will fall in love with that Irish singer (another guy) she met after Jerry died. We don't really know because the movie ended when she met him again in Ireland.

Quite a great film. I like it so much because at last I see a romantic movie that glorifies love between two married couple. All the other films describe love of unrelated couple, but this one was different.

Even though its sad, it teaches us the importance of being able to go one. People don't need to collapse when they lose someone they love. They need to know that this is life, and even if their loved ones have died, they are still alive in their hearts.

Wonderful movie, thumbs up

I was very excited to see this film because I had read - and loved - the novel by Cecelia Ahern. The novel tells a charming and bittersweet story of a young Irish widow (living in Ireland) and her journey to build a new life after her husband dies of a brain tumor. The title, the character names and the device of the letters are practically the only elements of that story that remain in the film.

To begin with, the story is relocated to New York which did nothing to enhance its appeal. Americans also enjoy movies set in other locales (remember Circle of Friends, Notting Hill, Chocolat, etc.). Also, the casting of Swank did not seem to fit the Holly character portrayed in the book. For that matter, the character written for the film did not match the more spirited and likable widow of the book. Overall the screenplay was poorly written and the extensive rewriting made what had been an uplifting story more of a gloomy movie. In fact, the movie has a pervasive feeling of gloom (as opposed to grief). In the book, Holly and her husband had been happy together, though this does not come through as clearly in the movie. While Holly had not been as fulfilled in her work, she seemed to have been a happy person. Again, the movie Holly was quite different. I was actually relieved when it was over.

Given the glowing reviews others have posted, perhaps the movie is only terribly disappointing to those familiar with the novel. If you have read and enjoyed the book, be prepared to see an entirely different version of the story if you decide to purchase this film. You might want to Netflix it first.

I never thought that I would say this, but `P.S. I Love You' is one of those movies that changed the way I viewed an actress, for the better.  Don't get me wrong; when Hilary Swank is on point she is ON POINT.  Just watch her stunning work in `Boys Don't Cry' or `Million Dollar Baby', both films garnered her Oscars.  The thing is, when you strip away the strength of the script or the power of the genre you have a substantial loss of talent.  Her performances in films like `Freedom Writers' or `The Core' and even `Insomnia' prove that she is not always `on point'.  That said, I was a little worried about how she'd fare with a romantic comedy (dramedy really).  I really thought she'd blow this one.

She nailed it.

I sat down to watch this movie with my wife because we are both fans of Gerard Butler (not because he's especially talented but more or less because he's nice to look at and or listen to) and we both adore the comedic talents of Lisa Kudrow.  We didn't expect too much, but what we got was a very nicely crafted tale of true love and the tragedy that is grief.

Holly and Gerry are a feisty married couple who obviously adore one another despite their differences.  This is seen in the opening scene (which lasts for like ten minutes) where they fight and then make up in a rather realistic manner.  That was my initial thought going into the movie; that it seemed real, and I wasn't expecting that at all.  Next we learn that due to a bran tumor Gerry has passed on.  Holly has a very hard time dealing with this, obviously, but she has friends and relatives intent of helping her through it.  It appears though, that the only one who can save her is Gerry, who comes back into her life through a series of letters he'd written and arranged to have delivered to her over the course of the next year.  With the help of these letters Holly learns to let go and find herself again, find that nave teenager Gerry first met and fell in love with; the girl with dreams and ambitions and a bright future.

Be forewarned, `P.S. I Love You' will most likely make you cry; or at least come very close.

The acting is very well done across the board.  Lisa Kudrow and Gina Gershon are both wonderful as Holly's closest friends.  I only wish that they had a little more screen time.  Kathy Bates is always wonderful, and her portrayal of Holly's protective mother is very genuine and moving.  I am not a huge fan of Harry Connick Jr., but he manages to be entertaining here.  I feel that his character was a little insensitive and rather unlikable at times, but it was what they were going for and he nailed it.

The stars of the show here are Swank and Butler who just ooze forth with chemistry that I didn't see coming.  We all know that Gerard Butler is a major dreamboat complete with a nice physic, an accent and loads of charm; but who would have thought that he was such a compelling actor?  He really nails his character inside and out and makes Gerry one of the most appealing men on screen.  I'm sure most any woman would love to have a husband like Gerry.  Swank blew me away with her mastery of her characters emotional fluctuations.  Holly is feisty one minute, giddy the next, defensive the next, heartbroken the next.  She's inspired and confused and aggravated and filled with adoration and she nails every shift, every feeling.  She gets every part of this woman right and delivers to us a complete and whole character, a person we can love and feel for.

Another thing I really appreciated about the film is that, as much as it is warm and sentimental, it never shies away from the harsh realities of grief.  Even the way that some of her friends deal with Holly, the way her mother almost resents her grieving at times, the way that Daniel can't seem to get passed the fact that there was a Gerry; the way that Denise and Sharon want to move on with their lives regardless of how that hurts Holly.  It makes for a much more realistic venture into the life of someone who has lost a loved one.

The world keeps on moving and eventually you have to catch up.

In the end I highly recommend this movie.  It is a truly above average film that understands how to make a romantic comedy that has the right amounts of dramatic tension and realism to make it more than just another genre film.  As far as these types of films go, this is truly one of the best.  This is a film that could easily get passed over by those who consider it just another one of many, but it rises to the challenge and becomes something much better than expected.

This movie is one Of The Best Love Stories I've ever seen. Great acting and humor in a situation that is heart warming. A good lesson too for anyone who has ever lost a loved one. I recommend it for everyone.
